result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Edward Hardie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad Edward Hardie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad Edward Hardie was found guilty of Stalking - Prev Conviction Violent Crime [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Edward Hardie

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Chad Edward Hardie in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Chad Edward Hardie.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf on behalf of Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant plead to Count 1. Count 2 to be dismissed. For Count 1, 4 years prison fashioned as 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed for 4 years probation. Conditions of probation include pay $20 fine plus costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, completion of Domestic Abuse Intervention Program (DAIP), continuation of no contact order. Probation concurrent with 19CF317. If revoked, consecutive to 19CF317. Defendant not eligible for prison programming. State has complied with Victims Rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Gramstrup stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. State notes defendant stipulates he is a repeater as charged in Count 1. Attorney Gramstrup agrees defendant is a repeater status. 

Court imposes for Count 1, 4 years prison fashioned as 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed for 4 years probation. Conditions of probation include pay $20 fine plus costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, completion of Domestic Abuse Intervention Program (DAIP), continuation of no contact order. Probation concurrent with 19CF317. If revoked, consecutive to 19CF317. Defendant not eligible for prison programming.
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:35 AM Defendant Chad Edward Hardie appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Chad Edward Hardie.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney receives information although filed late, waives reading, pleads not guilty, requests status.
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
1:37 PM Defendant Chad Edward Hardie appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Chad Edward Hardie.  Attorney Perter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Gramstrup is waiving preliminary. Defendant's waiver are knowingly, freely, and voluntarily made. Court finds probable cause and binds over for arraignment. 
Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with Victim #1 or Victim #1 residence

1:38 PM Defendant Chad Edward Hardie appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ellen Craker in court for Defendant. Attorney Craker notes defendant does not qualify for Public Defender at this time. Attorney Craker received complaint, waive reading and request preliminary hearing. State requests $5,000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1 and do not return to address of victim. Defendant has several failures to appear and severity of charges requests cash bail. Attorney Craker finds cash not necessary for appearance and defendant is on a probation hold. Notes 2009 and 2010 failures to appear. Court notes local ties and the nature of the offense that warrants cash bail. Court orders $500 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Victim #1 or Victim #1 residence.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
